intro: Amorphophallus thaiensis, commonly known as the Thai giant arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped (spear-shaped) leaves and striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces a large, underground tuber that serves as its storage organ. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its unique morphology and ornamental value, it is cultivated for both horticultural and culinary purposes.
